item.title: FREE Lectures on Church and State from Dr. Sam Waldron
item.dc:creator: CBTSeminary
item.description:
Given the ongoing discussion among Christians today on the relationship of church and state or between Christianity and politics, we are making available six lectures by Dr. Sam Waldron on the development of these institutions in Protestant history. Since understanding the historical development of this debate provides great insight into a biblical assessment of the relationship of […]

The post FREE Lectures on Church and State from Dr. Sam Waldron appeared first on Covenant Baptist Theological Seminary.
item.content:encoded:
Given the ongoing discussion among Christians today on the relationship of church and state or between Christianity and politics, we are making available six lectures by Dr. Sam Waldron on the development of these institutions in Protestant history. Since understanding the historical development of this debate provides great insight into a biblical assessment of the relationship of church and state, these video lectures are made freely available for personal growth and edification: http://goo.gl/xKqBEX

Dr. Waldron’s lectures come from his Modern and American Church History course, which is currently being taught. If you would like to be notified when this class becomes available online,please let our administrator know. We hope that this brief study will prove beneficial to the body of Christ!

CBTSeminary

CBTS Faculty fully subscribe to the 1689 Confession of Faith, hold an advanced
degree in their field of instruction, and possess significant pastoral experience.

http:

The post FREE Lectures on Church and State from Dr. Sam Waldron appeared first on Covenant Baptist Theological Seminary.

item.title: DEBATE: “Have the New Testament Charismatic Gifts Ceased?” Sam Waldron vs Michael Brown
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
Date: Nov. 7, 2013 Time: 5pm PST / 7pm CST / 8pm EST Where: THIS PAGE (via YouTube Live ) Hosted & Moderated: Alpha & Omega Ministries‘ The Dividing Line | Dr. James R White Dr. Michael Brown v. Dr. Samuel Waldron “Have The New Testament Charismatic Gifts Ceased?”  Format: 1. Michael Brown (1) Opening […]

The post DEBATE: “Have the New Testament Charismatic Gifts Ceased?” Sam Waldron vs Michael Brown appeared first on Covenant Baptist Theological Seminary.
item.content:encoded:
Date: Nov. 7, 2013
Time: 5pm PST / 7pm CST / 8pm EST
Where: THIS PAGE (via YouTube Live )
Hosted & Moderated: Alpha & Omega Ministries‘ The Dividing Line | Dr. James R White
Dr. Michael Brown v. Dr. Samuel Waldron
“Have The New Testament Charismatic Gifts Ceased?”
 

Format:

  • 1. Michael Brown (1) Opening – 15 min.
  • 2. Sam Waldron (2) Opening 15 min.
  • 3. 1) Rebuttal 10 min
  • 4. (2) Rebuttal 10 min
  • 5. Cross Examination (1) 15 min.
  • 6. Cross Examination (2) 15 min.
  • 7. Closing (1) 5 min.
  • 8. Closing (2) 5 min.

Livestream:

admin

CBTS Faculty fully subscribe to the 1689 Confession of Faith, hold an advanced
degree in their field of instruction, and possess significant pastoral experience.

The post DEBATE: “Have the New Testament Charismatic Gifts Ceased?” Sam Waldron vs Michael Brown appeared first on Covenant Baptist Theological Seminary.

item.title: Important New Missions Documentary
item.dc:creator: CBTSeminary
item.description:
Today, Red Futon Films released the official trailer for an important new documentary on missions to be released next month: Half-Devil Half-Child. If you care at all about the spread of the gospel among Muslim peoples around the world, then you will not want to miss this documentary. The trailer gives you a taste of […]

The post Important New Missions Documentary appeared first on Covenant Baptist Theological Seminary.
item.content:encoded:
Today, Red Futon Films released the official trailer for an important new documentary on missions to be released next month: Half-Devil Half-Child. If you care at all about the spread of the gospel among Muslim peoples around the world, then you will not want to miss this documentary. The trailer gives you a taste of this critical issue in international missions today:
